page.title: 18West Dean Environment
page.content: One of the recent major problems for the community has been an apparent decline in Forestry Commission interest.The Head Forester departed in Dec.1984-this coincided with the retirement of two other foresters. Previously,the Head Forester had organised labour/machinery to tidy the village and churchyard.Forestry houses have been sold to private owners and the administration of Friston Forest now takes place from Cambridge instead of Lyndhurst. There is however a high level of local involvement in maintaining the physical amenities of the village;the pond linked with the Cuckmere River, has been cleared by residents, geese and ducks provided by the owner of a local property.On weekends,some residents do voluntary work in the forest dealing with vandals,fires,etc.
